summary: This is an email exchange between a paralegal working on FOIA litigation for the New York Times regarding Epstein records and an Associate Warden at MCC New York. The paralegal asks detailed questions about the source and handling of various prison logbooks related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide watch, and the Associate Warden provides explanations and attachments.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, providing attachments and explanations about prison logbooks related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration. Their email signature includes their title and contact information.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.role: Lieutenant in the SIS department at MCC New York
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who received photocopies of original logbooks from the Associate Warden and subsequently released them to the FBI.

connections.description: The Associate Warden states they personally made photocopies of original logbooks and turned them over to the SIS department, specifically to Lt.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Watch Logging
events.description: References to Suicide Watch log books for July 23, 2019, located on the 2nd floor suicide watch area. One log notes staff was assigned watch duties, another notes an inmate companion assumed duties from staff.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Watch Logging
events.description: References to Suicide Watch log books for July 24, 2019, located on the 2nd floor suicide watch area.

events.title: Epstein Psychology Observation Logging
events.description: References to Psychology Observation log books for dates including July 8 and July 24, 2019, located on the 2nd floor suicide watch area, completed by an inmate companion.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is part of FOIA litigation filed by the New York Times regarding Jeffrey Epstein records.

It details the existence and location of specific prison logbooks related to Epstein's incarceration, including Attorney Conference, Lobby Attorney, Visual Search, Psychology Observation, Suicide Watch, and Intake Screening Phone logs.
The Associate Warden states they personally photocopied the original logbooks before they were turned over to the SIS department (Lt.), who then released them to the FBI.
The Associate Warden maintains a single electronic folder in their personal directory containing scanned documents responsive to various Epstein-related document requests.
The email clarifies procedural details about document handling and search efforts, which are required for the FOIA litigation process.
